get.description: Returns available routes based on the provided filters

schema.description: Number of routes to return
schema.title: Limit

schema.description: Maximum number of transactions involved in the route
schema.title: Max Steps

code.description: Returned when any of the input parameters are invalid
code.title: INVALID_INPUT

get.description: Returns tokens based on the provided filters

schema.description: Number of tokens to return
schema.title: Limit

code.description: Returned when any of the input parameters are invalid
code.title: INVALID_INPUT

get.description: Returns an estimated quote for a given intent. The quote is subject to change, use `/prepare` to get the transaction to execute with a quote.

schema.description: The origin chain ID
The origin token address
The destination chain ID
The destination token address

originAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the input token that must be paid to receive the desired amount (specified in the intent).

destinationAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the output token to be received by the receiver address.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this quote was generated at.

blockNumber.description: The block number this quote was generated at.

estimatedExecutionTimeMs.description: The estimated execution time in milliseconds. This includes all transactions involved in filling this quote.

inputAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the input token that must be paid to receive the desired amount (specified in the intent).

get.description: Returns an estimated quote for a given intent to purchase a token (the destination token). The quote is subject to change, use `/buy/prepare` to get the transaction to execute with a quote.

schema.description: The origin chain ID
The origin token address
The destination chain ID
The destination token address
The desired output amount in wei

originAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the input token that must be paid to receive the desired amount (specified in the intent).

destinationAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the output token to be received by the receiver address.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this quote was generated at.

blockNumber.description: The block number this quote was generated at.

estimatedExecutionTimeMs.description: The estimated execution time in milliseconds. This includes all transactions involved in filling this quote.

schema.description: Returned when the service timed out while processing the request
schema.title: TIMEOUT_ERROR

get.description: Returns an estimated quote for a given intent to sell a token (the origin token). The quote is subject to change, use `/sell/prepare` to get the transaction to execute with a quote.

schema.description: The origin chain ID
The origin token address
The destination chain ID
The destination token address
The desired input amount in wei

originAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the input token that must be paid to receive the desired amount (specified in the intent).

destinationAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the output token to be received by the receiver address.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this quote was generated at.

blockNumber.description: The block number this quote was generated at.

estimatedExecutionTimeMs.description: The estimated execution time in milliseconds. This includes all transactions involved in filling this quote.

schema.description: Returned when the service timed out while processing the request
schema.title: TIMEOUT_ERROR

get.description: Returns a prepared quote with transaction data ready to be executed

schema.description: The origin chain ID
The origin token address
The destination chain ID
The destination token address
The address that will send the input token.
The address that will receive the output token.
Arbitrary purchase data to be included with the payment and returned with all webhooks and status checks.

originAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the input token that must be paid to receive the desired amount (specified in the intent).

destinationAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the output token to be received by the receiver address.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this quote was generated at.

blockNumber.description: The block number this quote was generated at.

estimatedExecutionTimeMs.description: The estimated execution time in milliseconds. This includes all transactions involved in filling this quote.

id.description: A hex ID associated with the quoted payment.
The transaction ID, each step in a quoted payment will have a unique transaction ID.

expiration.description: The expiration timestamp for this prepared quote and its transactions (if applicable).

id.description: The transaction ID, each step in a quoted payment will have a unique transaction ID.

inputAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the input token that must be paid to receive the desired amount (specified in the intent).

schema.description: Returned when the service timed out while processing the request
schema.title: TIMEOUT_ERROR

get.description: Returns a link from the specified provider to onramp to the specified token (DEPRECATED: Use POST instead)

schema.description: The onramp provider to use
The destination chain ID
The destination token address
The desired token amount in wei
Arbitrary purchase data to be included with the payment and returned with all webhooks and status checks.
The address that will receive the output token.

The token to initially onramp to if the specified destination token is not supported by the onramp provider. This is useful if the wallet doesn't have funds to pay for gas and it must onramp to a native token first.
The chain ID to initially onramp to if the specified destination chain is not supported by the onramp provider.
The currency to use for the onramp. Defaults to the user's preferred currency.
The maximum number of post-onramp steps to allow for.
A list of chain IDs to exclude from the route. This is useful if there are certain chains your wallet doesn't support or to avoid more expensive chains.
Deprecated. Use `amount` instead.

id.description: The onramp ID. Use this to query for the onramp status.

link.description: The link to the onramp session. This should be opened or redirected to from the UI.

currency.description: The currency to use for the onramp.

currencyAmount.description: The onramp cost in the requested currency.

destinationAmount.description: The amount of the destination token to be received (in wei).

timestamp.description: The timestamp this quote was generated at.

expiration.description: The timestamp at which this onramp session will expire, if applicable.

id.description: The transaction ID, each step in a quoted payment will have a unique transaction ID.

steps.description: The route of tokens after the onramp to reach the final destination token. In the event of quote expirations, you can fetch a new quote for each token pair individually rather than executing the pre-assembled transactions array.

amount.description: The desired token amount in wei

purchaseData.description: Arbitrary purchase data to be included with the payment and returned with all webhooks and status checks.

receiver.description: The address that will receive the output token.

onrampTokenAddress.description: The token to initially onramp to if the specified destination token is not supported by the onramp provider. This is useful if the wallet doesn't have funds to pay for gas and it must onramp to a native token first.

onrampChainId.description: The chain ID to initially onramp to if the specified destination chain is not supported by the onramp provider.

currency.description: The currency to use for the onramp. Defaults to the user's preferred currency.

maxSteps.description: The maximum number of post-onramp steps to allow for.

excludeChainIds.description: A list of chain IDs to exclude from the route. This is useful if there are certain chains your wallet doesn't support or to avoid more expensive chains.

intent.description: The intent that was used to prepare the onramp.

schema.description: Returned when the service timed out while processing the request
schema.title: TIMEOUT_ERROR

get.description: Gets the status of an onramp transaction

schema.description: The onramp ID, provided when the onramp link was created

oneOf.description: The onramp has failed in some way.
The onramp link has been created but the user has not begun the payment process yet.
The user has started the onramp flow but has not completed it yet.
Funds have been received and assets have been transferred.

data.description: The status of an onramp transaction.

get.description: Returns a prepared transfer with transaction data ready to be executed (DEPRECATED: Use POST instead)

schema.description: The chain the transfer will take place on
The token to transfer. Use 0xEeeeeEeeeEeEeeEeEeEeeEEEeeeeEeeeeeeeEEeE for the chain's native token
The amount to transfer in wei
The address the tokens will be transferred from.
The address that will receive the transfer.
The address that will pay the fees for the transfer. If not specified, the sender will be used.
Arbitrary purchase data to be included with the payment and returned with all webhooks and status checks.

originAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the input token that must be paid to receive the desired amount (specified in the intent).

destinationAmount.description: The amount (in wei) of the output token to be received by the receiver address.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this quote was generated at.

blockNumber.description: The block number this quote was generated at.

estimatedExecutionTimeMs.description: The estimated execution time in milliseconds. This includes all transactions involved in filling this quote.

id.description: The payment ID, which is unique to all transactions involved in this quoted payment.
The transaction ID, each step in a quoted payment will have a unique transaction ID.

transactions.description: An array of transactions to be executed to fulfill this quote (in order).

expiration.description: The expiration timestamp for this prepared quote and its transactions (if applicable).

chainId.description: The chain the transfer will take place on

tokenAddress.description: The token to transfer. Use 0xEeeeeEeeeEeEeeEeEeEeeEEEeeeeEeeeeeeeEEeE for the chain's native token

transferAmountWei.description: The amount to transfer in wei

sender.description: The address the tokens will be transferred from.

receiver.description: The address that will receive the transfer.

feePayer.description: The address that will pay the fees for the transfer. If not specified, the sender will be used.

purchaseData.description: Arbitrary purchase data to be included with the payment and returned with all webhooks and status checks.

code.description: Returned when any of the input parameters are invalid
code.title: INVALID_INPUT

schema.description: Returned when the service timed out while processing the request
schema.title: TIMEOUT_ERROR
